Issue.creator: bcbrock
Issue.summary: Kafka orderer hangs if blocks are cut by a timeout
Issue.description: The way the timer reset is handled at lines 104-106 of orderer/kafka/broadcast.go assumes that if timer.Stop() returns false, then the timer channel contains an event. This is not true - and the Go documentation should be clearer on the semantics of timer.Stop(). The simple fix is to only remove events from the channel if there are known to be any in the channel. Otherwise, the goroutine hangs waiting for the now-stopped timer to produce an event.
